intro: Hofmeisteria fasciculata var. xantii, commonly known as the yellow-flowered hofmeisteria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a desirable species for rock gardens and xeriscaping. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
